definition: to do the job oneself
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: If you would have a thing well done, you must do it yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果要将事情做好，就得亲自动手。

sentences.english: Traditional espresso machines require the operator to manually create the espresso.
sentences.chinese: 传统的浓缩咖啡机需要操作者亲自动手才能进行生产。

sentences.english: There are some people who believe that if you want something done right, you’d better do it yourself.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为想把事办好就得亲自动手。

sentences.english: The students do the work, but every move is monitored by a professor.
sentences.chinese: 学生们会亲自动手，但每一个动作都由教授指导。

sentences.english: By using their own hands the professors have attained the objective of treatment.
sentences.chinese: 教授们亲自动手，达到了治疗的目的。

sentences.english: He is going to repair the machine by himself.
sentences.chinese: 他马上就要亲自动手修理机器了。

definition: to do (sth) oneself/to help oneself to
to do sth in place of sb else
personally/with one's own hands
to set about (a task)/to hit/to punch/to touch
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
to take great pains/to go to a lot of trouble
to go to war (idiom)/to make a big fuss over sth
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to do more than is required (idiom); superfluous/gilding the lily
to get involved in/to meddle/interference
to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to use sb for one's own ends
